title: One Geometry Problem
text:
This is a problem of Euclidean Geometry. See the figure below.Your task is as follows: given the lengths of segments b, c, and d, calculate the length of segment a.InputThe input begins with the number t of test cases in a single line (t ≤ 300). In each of
the next t lines there are three integers b, c and d  (0 ≤ b, c and d ≤ 10200; b, d < c)
separated by a space.OutputFor every test case print the length of the segment a, one number per line.ExampleInput:2
3 8 5
10 18 12Output:8
14
